direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the internal state of the Bloom filter, but in opposite ways (resetting vs. merging).
Similar to merge(BitMapExtractor), both methods alter the internal state of the Bloom filter, but in opposite ways.
The clear method resets the filter to an empty state, similar to the isEmpty method which checks if the filter is in an empty state.
Both methods involve iterating over the bitMap array, but clear resets the bits while processBitMaps processes them.
Both methods involve processing indices, but clear resets the filter while processIndices processes the indices.
The clear method resets the cardinality, which is a dependency for the estimateN method.
The clear method affects the cardinality, which is a dependency for the estimateIntersection method.
The clear method affects the cardinality, which is a dependency for the estimateUnion method.
